blogDescription: Explore our Web3 Blog ‚Äì your hub for news, events, and study notes! Contribute your insights, shaping the conversation in the world of decentralized tech.

TopBanner.title: Join our rapidly growing Community!
TopBanner.description: HackQuest advocates are your local Web3 superheroes: empowering others, addressing challenges, engaging communities, impacting the globe, and building a brighter future!

section1.title: Compensation Package
section1.description: We sincerely value your work and do not believe in making people work for free. If you are contributing to our vision, we are always happy to compensate you fairly for your hard work üí∞¬†Top advocates will also receive customized merch sets from HackQuest and our partners.

section2.description: We always appreciate your feedback üíå¬†As an advocate, you will work alongside our amazing core team based globally in the USA, the Greater China area, India, and Singapore.

ApplyAdvocate.title: Apply to become an advocate now üôå

FAQS.title: FAQs
FAQS.description: For more questions, join our Discord / Telegram and DM your question directly!

question1.problem: I am currently an advocate for other communities. Am I still eligible to be an advocate for HackQuest?
question1.answer: Absolutely! You can be an advocate for us while running other communities. We welcome collaborations across communities as well.

question2.problem: Do I have to be a Web 3.0 developer to be qualified as an advocate?
question2.answer: No! You don‚Äôt have to be a developer or work full-time in web3 at all to be an advocate. As long as you‚Äôre passionate about Web 3.0 and like to empower others and organize events, you‚Äôre more than welcome to apply. In fact, we are launching other career tracks outside of smart contract development soon. Stay tuned!

question3.problem: What can I get from being an advocate?
question3.answer: At HackQuest, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to our advocates. There are monetary benefits for the task you complete (yes you are not doing unpaid work), meeting with Web 3.0 industry leaders, turning your proposed events into reality, unique opportunities to convert into a fellow, intern, or even full-time employee at HackQuest, and so much more!

question4.problem: What do I need to prepare for events? Do I have to prepare materials by myself?
question4.answer: No need to sweat about prepping! We provide swags for you to use. All you need to do is to write down your ideas in a proposal and submit them to us, so we can help you to make it real.

question5.problem: What is the time commitment of an advocate?
question5.answer: It‚Äôs entirely up to you! Most advocates do extras and stay active. However, the base requirements as an advocate should take ~3-5 hours per month.
